com.paypal.android.sdk.payments

Class PayPalConfiguration

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.paypal.android.sdk.payments.PayPalConfiguration

  • public final class PayPalConfiguration
extends Object
    Defines the configuration parameters for the SDK, via the PayPalService.EXTRA_PAYPAL_CONFIGURATION intent extra at service startup.

      • ENVIRONMENT_PRODUCTION

        public static final String ENVIRONMENT_PRODUCTION
        Live production environment. Real money will be moved in this environment.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ENVIRONMENT_SANDBOX

        public static final String ENVIRONMENT_SANDBOX
        Sandbox environment. Used for development & testing.

        Sandbox transactions can be seen in the dashboard.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ENVIRONMENT_NO_NETWORK

        public static final String ENVIRONMENT_NO_NETWORK
        Mock environment. Pre-packaged fake transactions only.

        The SDK will not attempt to contact PayPal's servers with this environment.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • languageOrLocale

        public PayPalConfiguration languageOrLocale(String languageOrLocale)
        Optional string value. The preferred language for all strings appearing in the user interface. If not set, or if set to null, defaults to the device's current language setting.

        Can be specified as a language code ("en", "fr", "zh-Hans", etc.) or as a locale ("en_AU", "fr_FR", "zh-Hant_HK", etc.).

        If the library does not contain localized strings for a specified locale, then will fall back to the language. E.g., "es_CO" -> "es".
        If the library does not contain localized strings for a specified language, then will fall back to American English.

        If you specify only a language code, and that code matches the device's currently preferred language, then the library will attempt to use the device's current region as well. E.g., specifying "en" on a device set to "English" and "United Kingdom" will result in "en_GB".

        These localizations are currently included:
        da, de, en, en_AU, en_GB, en_SV, es, es_MX, fr, he, it, ja, ko, nb, nl, pl, pt, pt_BR, ru, sv, tr, zh-Hans, zh-Hant_HK, zh-Hant_TW.
        Returns:
        this PayPalConfiguration object

      • environment

        public PayPalConfiguration environment(String environment)
        Sets the environment to use. Defaults to ENVIRONMENT_PRODUCTION.
        Returns:
        this PayPalConfiguration object

      • defaultUserEmail

        public PayPalConfiguration defaultUserEmail(String defaultUserEmail)
        Optional string that pre-populates email login if no other information is available.

        If your app has knowledge of the user's email, you can provide it here. However, it may be overridden by PayPal.
        Returns:
        this PayPalConfiguration object

      • defaultUserPhone

        public PayPalConfiguration defaultUserPhone(String defaultUserPhone)
        Optional string that pre-populates phone number login if no other information is available.

        Same as email, but for phone number.
        Returns:
        this PayPalConfiguration object

        Returns:
        this PayPalConfiguration object

      • forceDefaultsOnSandbox

        public PayPalConfiguration forceDefaultsOnSandbox(boolean forceDefaultsOnSandbox)
        Optional boolean for development. In non-live environments, use the default* values defined in this class.
        Returns:
        this PayPalConfiguration object

      • sandboxUserPassword

        public PayPalConfiguration sandboxUserPassword(String sandboxUserPassword)
        Optional string for development. In non-live environments, pre-populate this value for user password.
        Returns:
        this PayPalConfiguration object

        public PayPalConfiguration sandboxUserPin(String sandboxUserPin)
        Optional string for development. In non-live environments, pre-populate this value for user PIN.

        this PayPalConfiguration object

      • acceptCreditCards

        public PayPalConfiguration acceptCreditCards(boolean acceptCreditCards)
        Optional boolean to indicate support for credit cards. Defaults to true.

        If false, the SDK will skip directly to the PayPal login screen for payments.
        Returns:
        this PayPalConfiguration object

      • rememberUser

        public PayPalConfiguration rememberUser(boolean rememberUser)
        Optional boolean to control persistence of user.
        If set to true, then if the user pays via their PayPal account, the SDK will remember the user's PayPal username or phone number; if the user pays via their credit card, then the SDK will remember the PayPal Vault token representing the user's credit card.
        If set to false, then any previously-remembered username, phone number, or credit card token will be erased, and subsequent payment information will not be remembered.
        Defaults to true.
        Parameters:
        rememberUser -
        Returns:
        this PayPalConfiguration object

      • clientId

        public PayPalConfiguration clientId(String clientId)
        Required string - the client id from developer.paypal.com.

        Returns:
        this PayPalConfiguration object

      • merchantName

        public PayPalConfiguration merchantName(String merchantName)
        Your company name, as it should be displayed to the user when requesting consent for future payments. Only required for future payments.
        Returns:
        this PayPalConfiguration object

      • merchantPrivacyPolicyUri

        public PayPalConfiguration merchantPrivacyPolicyUri(Uri merchantPrivacyPolicyUri)
        URL of your company's privacy policy, which will be offered to the user when requesting consent for future payments. Only required for future payments.
        Returns:
        this PayPalConfiguration object

      • merchantUserAgreementUri

        public PayPalConfiguration merchantUserAgreementUri(Uri merchantUserAgreementUri)
        URL of your company's user agreement, which will be offered to the user when requesting consent for future payments. Only required for future payments.
        Returns:
        this PayPalConfiguration object

      • getApplicationCorrelationId

        public static final String getApplicationCorrelationId(Activity activity)
        Gets an Application Correlation ID at the time of future payment activity. Once a user has consented to future payments, when the user subsequently initiates a PayPal payment from their device to be completed by your server, PayPal uses a Correlation ID to verify that the payment is originating from a valid, user-consented device+application. This helps reduce fraud and decrease declines. This method MUST be called prior to initiating a pre-consented payment (a "future payment") from a mobile device. Pass the result to your server, to include in the payment request sent to PayPal. Do not otherwise cache or store this value.
        Parameters:
        activity - The Activity making this call
        Returns:
        The applicationCorrelationID - Your server will send this to PayPal in a 'Paypal-Application-Correlation-Id' header.

      • getLibraryVersion

        public static final String getLibraryVersion()
        Gets the version of the PayPal Mobile SDK in use. Version numbering follows http://semver.org/. Please be sure to include this library version in tech support requests.
